PalHudun.NAME: Top-tier Shield
PalHudun.FLAVOR: A raging fire burned all research materials, giving birth to the highest quality shield.
DESCRIPTIONS: When picked up, research level resets. Monsters will prioritize attacking your Parus.

KonoKeeper.NAME: I'm the Boss
DESCRIPTIONS: When entering a normal monster room, there is a #b15% chance to turn the current room into a shop.

Randommonster.NAME: Random Mimicker
Randommonster.FLAVOR: The Random Mimicker recalls a unique encounter with zombies. Unlike others who rely on Peashooters and Jalapeños, he trusts in his unique ability to randomly generate enemies or allies.
DESCRIPTIONS: At the start of your turn, summon a random friendly monster and a random enemy monster.

Yuzaohu.NAME: Cute Fox
Yuzaohu.FLAVOR: The idol of the Palos Islands. Anyone who dares to bully CuteFox will become a public enemy in the blink of an eye.
DESCRIPTIONS: When defeating elites or bosses, there is a 50% chance to drop a Pal Ball

BattleBell.NAME: BattleBell
DESCRIPTIONS: Enemies get random Powers

PokeBall_BluePrint.NAME: Palu Ball Manufacturing Blueprint
PokeBall_BluePrint.FLAVOR: The cost of Palu is determined by how many Palu Balls it takes, with a regular Palu Ball costing one Palu Ore + three Wood + three Stone. If the materials produced by a Palu's work cannot exceed several times his cost, then the work intensity must be increased.
DESCRIPTIONS: Manufacturing Palu Balls requires half the usual gold coins

PalBed.NAME: Advanced Palu Bed
PalBed.FLAVOR: A large bed used by Palu for a good sleep. Available for Palu to rest during injuries or at night. Even a large Palu can have a good sleep on this big bed.
DESCRIPTIONS: While Palu rests, an additional 15 health is restored

CYSDX.NAME: Emerald Leaf Rat Statue
CYSDX.FLAVOR: An incredible Pal statue, ubiquitous throughout the Pal Islands. Offering items to a certain statue allows for player empowerment.
DESCRIPTIONS: When summoning Pal, the player gains one Strength.

YEMEI.NAME: Wild Berry
YEMEI.FLAVOR: A versatile ingredient that is delicious whether eaten raw or roasted. It can be seen everywhere on the island.
DESCRIPTIONS: When picking up, all PAL's increase in health by 15

D6.NAME: Paru Ball Upgrade Device
DESCRIPTIONS: Make your existing Paru Ball have a 100% capture success rate (for debugging purposes, will not appear in normal gameplay).

DeathBook.NAME: Swarm Bell
DeathBook.FLAVOR: It is said to have come from a very cold area.
DESCRIPTIONS: Starting from Act 2, gain [E] at the beginning of battles. Monsters will travel with monsters of the same level as the previous act. (For those who want a challenge)

TechnologyTree.NAME: Testing Tool
TechnologyTree.FLAVOR: Just a testing tool, please do not obtain in normal gameplay?
DESCRIPTIONS: Mouse over relics to see current technology. You can develop technology at the campfire.

D4.NAME: Paru Shield
D4.FLAVOR: An incredible shield made by Paru Mine Technology!
DESCRIPTIONS: When summoning a Paru, gain 2 points of temporary armor.

PunchingBag.NAME: Queen Bee's Staff
PunchingBag.FLAVOR: The modified Queen Bee's staff, specially made for human use. NL Can feel the queen's majesty exposed.
DESCRIPTIONS: Right-click to get an Aim+ card, Parus will prioritize attacking the targeted enemy.

PokeGo.NAME: Paru Ball
DESCRIPTIONS: Right-click to get a Paru Ball (costs 1 energy). NL The lower the health, the higher the capture rate. NL Each Paru Ball can control up to one Paru (replaceable).

BFFS.NAME: Power Stone Statue
BFFS.FLAVOR: A stone statue mentioned in the legend of Paros Island. Offer the Emerald Rat statue to the statue to gain incredible power.
DESCRIPTIONS: All your Parus start with 3 Strength.

Void.NAME: Void
DESCRIPTIONS: 6 charges. Right-click during even charges to absorb a relic from the relic list once, adding 1 charge (cannot absorb Blossoming Mark, passive relics get random initial attributes, active relics get active effects, when fully charged, trigger all absorbed active relic effects).

Habit.NAME: Cricket Fighter Modifier
DESCRIPTIONS: Enhance the strength of card-carrying monsters in Cricket Fighter, adjust the technology level to 2, and remove all entries (for debugging purposes, will not appear in normal gameplay).

BloodBag.NAME: Survival Guide
BloodBag.FLAVOR: Defeat all high tower bosses in each area and become the strongest Paru Trainer!
DESCRIPTIONS: Right-click on this relic in battle to view the tutorial.

Qieroudao.NAME: Meat Cleaver
DESCRIPTIONS: You can dismember Parus at the campfire to obtain resources.

NineVolt.NAME: Merit
NineVolt.FLAVOR: Knocking on the electronic fish, accumulating cyber-merit, seeing Hatsune Miku.
DESCRIPTIONS: At the start of the battle, for each point of merit, there is a 1% increase in the chance of monsters fleeing.
